Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
interesting unfun fact:
on OSX, if you delete a dir that is open in terminal, recreate that dir, and attempt to run something in the dir then terminal will run from the `.Trash` version of the dir
you have to cd out and back or open a new teminal to use the new dir 游땪

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: unix too. the location that was opened is the location the terminal will be in, until changed.

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: I have an asset chain currently running. I created an installer that automatically installs komodo onto a computer, because I wanna get a couple friends connected to my chain with their own computers so we can send my coins back and forth to eachother and I plan to make a prototype wallet for the coins. To connect additional computers, would it just be the same command: ./komodod -ac_name=HELLOWORLD -ac_supply=777777 -addnode=<IP address of the first node> ?

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: its just a simple test chain that im going to learn on

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: use public IP for the `addnode` param. any node can be connected to the network using that

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: everyone just have to use the same command with same ip preferrably. if there are more node with public ip, you can use that too. but, having one works fine

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can see example here https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/dev/src/assetchains.old

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: sweet

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: yea thats what i figured, just wanted to make sure. thanks man

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@dukeleto 

I'm going through your updates to the Komodo manual right now, adding them to dev documentation.

I'm working on `z_listunspent`. We currently have no entry for this call.

I'm trying to use a regtest chain to generate an example command, but I'm doing something wrong, and I'm not sure what. There's some sapling/regtest-related output that has me a bit confused.

Take a look:

```
sidd@sidd:~/komodo/src$ ./komodo-cli -ac_name=HELLO z_sendmany "RVkGrs5v3so3aSk92vhAPtUEJR2Uj5QGuh" '[{"address":"zregtestsapling1hz9tnmz0w4zz94u8pa26na8r0drfd3dpavk078wpky365c5n7u9jta0xhum5hnkg7vyzvz7zs40","amount":1000}]'
error code: -8
error message:
Invalid parameter, unknown address format: zregtestsapling1hz9tnmz0w4zz94u8pa26na8r0drfd3dpavk078wpky365c5n7u9jta0xhum5hnkg7vyzvz7zs40
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: I got the z addr using `z_getnewaddress`

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: sapling z address starts with `zs` not sure about regtestmode

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: why don't you use BEER or PIZZA instead of creating a new chain and using regtest mode?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: or any other existing chain

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
`./komodo-cli -ac_name=BEER z_sendmany RGHitvk13noGDZfHDKacnThMRqJbBmS9cC "[{\"address\": \"zs1ya2k2wwkhz8xvf6069z6utjnxt50nemz2g9uxu30xp58yfmnjl6dpds0td6ufkfx09kyu3vxs04\",\"amount\": 25000}]"`
this one should work

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @Bryan_Beus ^^

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if you want to use regtest mode specifically, dukeleto or Mylo can help

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
ok.

I'm trying to add a few examples to the documentation, and regtest is the way i normally do this.

Content:
I suppose I can use BEER or PIZZA, I would just need to get them synced and get some.

I'm assuming there's a faucet.

Content: i can send you BEER if you need that for testing. there are also faucets available in atomicexplorer.com for them

Content: ok

curl --user userXX:passXXXX --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method":"z_listunspent", "params": [1 100 false "[\"zs1wqykmk74mv2ezjscpxsgzrn4fasqwh50tgk0ym64m45c5yw5fjtpkps64gle963veqzuj04872z\"]" }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:8923
